caption.p: Plants with antidiabetic potential from Iran.

tr.td: Prevent diabetes associated complications; decreased the levels of serum lipids and MDA, significantly increased the activity of antioxidant enzymes
Elevated expression of both insulin and glucose transporters transcripts
Elevated expression of both insulin and glucose transporters transcripts
Decreased level of triglyceride, vLDL, and alkaline phosphatase
Decreased total cholesterol, LDL, TG, Cr, and alkaline phosphatase levels, increased ALT, ASTT, total number and numerical density of β-cells increased
Increase in the serum insulin level
100 and 200 mg/kg, i.p., one month, alternate day
Decreased the serum levels of the liver enzymes and tissue level of MDA, and the activity of the liver tissue’s antioxidant enzymes was increased
Significant decrease in TG, cholesterol, LDL, ALT, AST, ALP, total bilirubin, Cr and urea, increase in HDL-cholesterol and total protein
Extract did not possess the hypoglycemic and hypolipidemic activity.
Significantly increased liver glycogen and body weight
Decreased ALT, cholesterol, LDL, HDL, increased TG, AST
There was no evidence of regeneration in the liver of diabetic rats, brings the blood glucose significantly toward normal values from day 2 onwards
Dose-dependent decrease in blood sugar, decrease in triglycerides
Decreased LDL, AL, ALP, insulin levels did not increase, increased HDL

No significant influence on the insulin level, decreased blood TG, cholesterol content, reduced the mRNA expression, enzyme activities of glucose-6- phosphatase and phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase in liver
Streptozocin, Streptozocin and niacinamide diabetic rats
Normalization of blood ALT, TG, total cholesterol, HB1C
Enhanced regeneration of B-cells, increased size of pancreatic islet, improvement of hepatic tissue
Less severe hepatic portal inflammation, antidyslipidemia effects
Reduced cholesterol, TG, LDL and CRP levels
The extracts were not effective in reducing blood glucose levels in normal and diabetic rats
20, 62.5 g/kg eucalyptus in the diet, and 2.5 g/L extract in drinking water, 4 weeks
Dose-dependent amelioration of diabetic states by partial restoration of pancreatic β-cells
Increase ALT, AST and ALP activity
Protective effect of liver and kidney damage
50 mg/kg significantly lowered the serum glucose concentration
Decreased LDL, leptin, increased TG, VLDL, AST
Alleviation of diabetic complications such as nephropathy
Restored body weight, long term benefits
Reduced insulin, HbA1C, total cholesterol, LDL, VLDL, HDL and TG
Reduced HbA1C, total cholesterol, LDL and TG
Significant increase in diameter and number of β-cells compared to diabetic control group
Significant inhibition of α-glucosidase, maltaseand sucrase enzymes
Decrease in total cholesterol and LDL
Streptozocin diabetic rats, C187 β-cell line
Decreased MDA and increased GSH levels in the liver
Helped prevent the entering of the remaining β-cells into some pathologic changes, such as hypertrophy
Extract: 100, 200, 400 mg/kg, 14 days Fractions: 50, 100, 200 mg/kg, 14 days
Decrease in water intake, serum TG and cholesterol, increase in plasma insulin level
Enhanced glutathione content as well as the activity of catalase, decrease in total cholesterol and TG
Decreased serum TG cholesterol, increased antioxidant status
Decreased triglycerides, no hypoglycemic or hepatoprotective effect in diabetic rats
Increased serum HDL, superoxide dismutase and catalase activities, reduced LDL, inhibited maltase and sucrase activities
Increase catalase activities in liver and kidney
Non-significant reductions for the non-diabetic groups that received extracts.
Elevated expression of both Ins and Glut-4 transcripts

Carbon tetrachloride extract showed the best and most significant hypoglycemic and hypolipidemic activities with a β-cells-protecting effect from high glucose-induced apoptosis, and also increased insulin level and sensitivity
Decreased serum total cholesterol, LDL, increased HDL
Securigenin glycosides (isolated) reduced blood glucose equivalent to glibenclamide and elevated insulin level to normal
Improved lipid profile, decreased Ca/Mg ratio, decrease vessel atherosclerosis and prevented diabetic vesselcomplications
No decrease in body weight for diabetic rats
Enhanced GSH content as well as the activity of catalase, decrease in total cholesterol and TG
Prevents islet atrophy and/or regenerate pancreatic β-cells
Decreased LDL, leptin, LDL/HDL ratio, FIRI (fasting insulin resistance index), increased serum TG, VLDL, and AST
Streptozocin diabetic rats, RIN-5F and L6 myotubes cell lines
Regeneration and less β cell damage, increased insulin secretion in the RIN-5F cells and glucose uptake in the L6 myotubes cells, lower TG and cholesterol
Pancreatic protective effects in natural aged and aging model mice
Decrease in in plasma ALP, AST, ALT, and significant increase in total protein and insulin
